wikipedia_page.main: Christopher David Futcher (born 1958) is a British Anglican priest who has been Archdeacon in Cyprus since his collation on 7 September 2019; he was previously Archdeacon of Exeter since 2012.

link_mentions.page: List of alumni of King's College London
Diocese of Cyprus and the Gulf
response: The Diocese of Cyprus and the Gulf is one of four dioceses in the Episcopal Church in Jerusalem and the Middle East, a province in the Anglican Communion. It covers Cyprus and the Arabian Peninsula, Iraq and Yemen. The bishop in Cyprus and the GulfCrockford's Clerical Directory (97th ed. London: Church House Publishing, 2001), p. 1144, column a: 'Cyprus and the Gulf (Bishop in) [emphasis in original]. is the Ordinary of the diocese. In every part of the diocese, except in Cyprus and Iraq, the congregations are largely expatriate, with many Christians from Pakistan, India, Sri Lanka, the Philippines and the African continent. The diocese is linked with the Diocese of Exeter in England and the Diocese of Thika in Kenya. The diocese is divided into the Archdeaconry of Cyprus and the Archdeaconry of the Gulf: Christopher Futcher was collated archdeacon in Cyprus on 7 September 2019.
*28 April 20127 September 2019 (res.): Christopher FutcherExeter Cathedral News, March 2012  (became Archdeacon in Cyprus)
